intro: Spilanthes mutisii, commonly known as the mountain spilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow to orange in color. Spilanthes mutisii is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly for its potential anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial effects.
